thread.section_title: Sports - Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA
thread.title: Lady Wildcats win 19th volleyball match

author: Matt Henry Midway Driller Sports Writer mhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com
title: Lady Wildcats win 19th volleyball match
text: Lady Wildcats win 19th volleyball match Team defeats RFK in three sets Comment Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA By Matt Henry Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 7:47 PM By Matt Henrymhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 7:47 PM The Taft varsity volleyball team showed no signs of letting up at home Thursday evening when they blew past the Robert F. Kennedy Thunderbirds 25-14, 25-13 and 25-5. Taft didn't waste anytime getting going when they jumped out to a 7-2 lead to begin the first set including the opening three points. Robert F. Kennedy bounced back by cutting the lead down to three, but Taft countered with a 5-2 run. Following a Lady Thunderbirds point, Taft put together a mini 2-0 run to lead 15-8. Robert F. Kennedy answered with a 2-0 run. However, Taft caught fire with 6-2 run to up the lead to 21-12. The Lady Thunderbirds would score two out of the next three points to trail by eight. Taft answered with the final three points to win the first set. Taft carried that momentum into the second set where they outscored Robert F. Kennedy 4-1. The Lady Thunderbirds bounced back to tie the score at four. The teams would tie each other three more times before Taft attempted to pull away with a 4-0 run. The Lady Thunderbirds whittled the deficit down to three but Taft took off with an 8-2 run to lead 19-10. Robert F. Kennedy snapped the streak but Taft followed up with a 6-2 to run to take the second set. Like the previous two sets, the Lady Wildcats took off at the start of the third set with a 5-1 run. The Lady Thunderbirds would cut the lead in half at 6-3 and again at 8-4 but that was the last time the third set was close. Over the following moments of the set, the Lady Wildcat went on a 17-1 run including 12 straight points to begin the run to win the set and match. By Matt Henry
